page.title: 09RELIGION IN WOODLAND-CHURCH
page.content: The majority of people do not attend the churches.My family go to church every week but some only go when it is a family service.More old people than young people attend. In the winter {attendence}is low.Approximately eleven attend services at Woodland about fifty at St.Johns and nine at Chapel. I attend Church of England.The{Vicar is{Rev.N King}he has been Vicar for one year. There are two Church of England churches, St.Marys Woodland built in 1915 and St.Johns Lynesack built in 1847. When there are no services at Woodland we go to Lynesack. The services last about 1 hour 15 minutes. The{Methodist Chapel}in the village is 159 years old and seats 150 people. The{Minister}is{Mr N. Wakeling.}There are no activities connected with the Chapel.
